column4: I have a somewhat weird problem.     Basically, on one of my laptops, I'm running gutsy/7.10.    I went to upgrade to Hardy Heron, and it said I had 3rd party pkgs disabled. That's fine;  I went into synaptic and checked the relevent repos.    Did an apt-get update/apt-get upgrade.      Then I restarted.    I'm now in 'low-graphics' mode and the network appears not to work.      Any idea what caused this (and what the remedy is)?

First, make sure that your loopback interface is represented by two lines in /etc/network/interfaces, and one line is /etc/hosts. Then you might also want to run 'ip link show' and check if your loopback is UP.
Yesterday, I damaged one of those definitions, and the whole desktop went awry... just like you've described.
thanks for the info.   I'm gonna look into it more tomorrow (2AM here).    Night all.
